smother.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to completely cover the whole surface of something with something else, often in a way that seems unnecessary or unpleasant
smother.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to kill someone by putting something over their face to stop them breathing
smother.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: A teenage mother was accused of smothering her 3-month-old daughter.
smother.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to stop yourself from showing your feelings or from doing an action
smother.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The girls tried to smother their giggles.
smother.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to give someone so much love and attention that they feel as if they are not free and become unhappy
smother.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I don’t want him to feel smothered.
smother.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to make a fire stop burning by preventing air from reaching it
smother.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: We used a wet towel to smother the fire.
smother.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to get rid of anyone who opposes you – used to show disapproval
